summary:
Pasteurization is a method of keeping food fresh and safe by heating it gently. This process, named after scientist Louis Pasteur, helps to kill harmful germs and bacteria in food like milk and juice. It makes sure that the food stays good for longer without spoiling.

In Japan, they use this technique to treat milk, ensuring it's safe to drink. The process involves heating the milk to a specific temperature to get rid of any unwanted microorganisms. This way, people can enjoy fresh and healthy milk without worrying about getting sick.
title: Pasteurization
